title: Casio fx-7000G
summary: The Casio FX-7000G is a calculator which is widely known as being the world's first graphing calculator available to the public. It was introduced to the public and later manufactured between 1985 and c. 1988.[2] Notable features are its ability to graph functions,[3] and that it is programmable. The calculator offers 82 scientific functions and is capable of manual computation for basic arithmetic problems.[4]
